parInfo.parDescription: "Allows the MHub to use MProfiler supplied EOBD data to parse unsolicited vehicle proprietary data. This parameter should be managed by MProfiler."
parInfo.parNotes: "Allows the MHub to use MProfiler supplied EOBD data to parse unsolicited vehicle proprietary data. This parameter should be managed by MProfiler."

parInfo.parDescription: "Aux Port Baudrate"
parInfo.parNotes: "Aux Port Baudrate: 300...9600...115200"

parInfo.parDescription: "Aux Port Configuration"
parInfo.parNotes: "Aux Port Configuration Parameter. 0 - Standard 81 Protocol Port 1 - Custom Functionality 1 n - Custom Functionality n 255 - NMEA Port"

parInfo.parDescription: "Sets the number of minutes that the unit will stand off from the CAN bus when a message from an ECU ID corresponding with CAN Standoff Trigger on XPlatform is detected. The intended use is to standoff when another diagnostic tool is detected on the bus."
parInfo.parNotes: "Sets the number of minutes that the unit will stand off from the CAN bus when a message from an ECU ID corresponding with CAN Standoff Trigger on XPlatform is detected. The intended use is to standoff when another diagnostic tool is detected on the bus."

parInfo.parDescription: "When a valid card is read the vehicle is de-immobilized"
parInfo.parNotes: "When a valid card is read the vehicle is de-immobilized"

parInfo.parName: Card Reader Dangerous Goods control immobilization
parInfo.parDescription: "When a valid card is read and the license type indicate dangerous goods the vehicle is de-immobilized"
parInfo.parNotes: "When a valid card is read and the license type indicate dangerous goods the vehicle is de-immobilized"

parInfo.parDescription: "Driver ID to be used when de-immobilizing a vehicle with a card"
parInfo.parNotes: "Driver ID to be used when de-immobilizing a vehicle with a card"

parInfo.parName: Clear Fuel Flow Counts on Event
parInfo.parDescription: "Clear the Fuel Flow Meter Count values when the event is generated"
parInfo.parNotes: "Clear the Fuel Flow Meter Count values when the event is generated"

parInfo.parDescription: "This can be used to indicated version information regarding the configuration that was used"
parInfo.parNotes: "This can be used to indicated version information regarding the configuration that was used. Eg. Default V01"

parInfo.parDescription: "Text field to store customer information to be used with custom functions."
parInfo.parNotes: "Text field to store customer information to be used with custom functions."

parInfo.parDescription: "Text field to store customer information to be used with custom functions."
parInfo.parNotes: "Text field to store customer information to be used with custom functions."

parInfo.parDescription: "Text field to store customer information to be used with custom functions."
parInfo.parNotes: "Text field to store customer information to be used with custom functions."

parInfo.parDescription: "Text field to store customer information to be used with custom functions."
parInfo.parNotes: "Text field to store customer information to be used with custom functions."

parInfo.parDescription: "The Driver Key Type indicates what kind of Driver Key device is allowed to be used for Driver Identification and vehicle immobilization. Values: 0,8,255 = Standard DS1992 based Scope Driver Key initialized properly using the Scope Driver Key programmer software. 1 = DS1990 where Bytes 1 and 2 of the device serial number is used as the Driver ID 170 = ScopeID where the device ID contains the Driver ID, Fleet Code and Vehicle Class All other values are reserved"
parInfo.parNotes: "The Driver Key Type indicates what kind of Driver Key device is allowed to be used for Driver Identification and vehicle immobilization. Values: 0,8 = Standard DS1992 based Scope Driver Key initialized properly using the Scope Driver Key programmer software. 1 = DS1990 where Bytes 1 and 2 of the device serial number is used as the Driver ID 170 = ScopeID where the device ID contains the Driver ID, Fleet Code and Vehicle Class 255 = Any supported key All other values are reserved"

parInfo.parDescription: "Switch all debug statements ON or OFF"
parInfo.parNotes: "The value represents the debug time-out in minutes. Setting the value to 255 is a special case causing the debugs to be permanently active."

parInfo.parName: Enable CAN Controller Automatic Bus Off
parInfo.parDescription: "Allow the CAN controller to automatically drop off the buss. NB: IT IS HIGHTLY RECOMMENDED NOT TO CHANGE THIS PARAMETER 0xAC (172) - Enable Auto Buss Off 0x53 (83) - Disable Auto Buss Off Any other value leaves the default state of Automatic Retries active."
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Allow the CAN controller to automatically drop off the buss. NB: IT IS HIGHTLY RECOMMENDED NOT TO CHANGE THIS PARAMETER 0xAC (172) - Enable Auto Buss Off 0x53 (83) - Disable Auto Buss Off Any other value leaves the default state of Automatic Retries active."

parInfo.parDescription: "Allow the CAN controller to automatically retry any failed transmissions. On some vehicles this can cause buss interference. 0xAC (172) - Enable Automatic Retries 0x53 (83) - Disable Automatic Retries Any other value leaves the default state of Automatic Retries active."
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Allow the CAN controller to automatically retry any failed transmissions. On some vehicles this can cause buss interference. 0xAC (172) - Enable Automatic Retries 0x53 (83) - Disable Automatic Retries Any other value leaves the default state of Automatic Retries active."

parInfo.parDescription: "Driver Key Used"
parInfo.parNotes: "If the driver key is used, then this parameter must be set to 1"

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable Error Debug Messages"
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Setting this parameter to 1 will enable Error Debug messages"

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable Info Debug Messages"
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Setting this parameter to 1 will enable Info Debug messages"

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable the IPC comms to the MHub Extender"
parInfo.parNotes: "Enable the IPC comms to the MHub Extender"

parInfo.parDescription: "Enables the use of the ISO14230-3 Command Set. This should only be enabled on vehicles that are known to support this protocol."
parInfo.parNotes: "Enables the use of the ISO14230-3 Command Set. This should only be enabled on vehicles that are known to support this protocol."

parInfo.parDescription: "Enables the controller to go into listen only mode after closing a session. NOTE: This is necessary to recover from some errors"
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Enables the controller to go into listen only mode after closing a session. NOTE: This is necessary to recover from some errors"

parInfo.parName: Enable OBD2 Login on CAN activity
parInfo.parDescription: "Allows the initialisation of OBD when CAN activity is detected. Note: Needs Listen Only mode to be enabled to work."
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Allows the initialisation of OBD when CAN activity is detected. Note: Needs Listen Only mode to be enabled to work."

parInfo.parDescription: "Enables UDS/ISO14229 commands sent from XPlatform. "
parInfo.parNotes: "Enables UDS/ISO14229 commands sent from XPlatform."

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable Vehicle On Board Diagnostics CANBus Interface Note: Enable J1939 FMS CANBus Interface = 0"
parInfo.parNotes: "Enable ISO15765 Protocol interface using the CANBus interface. Disable the J1939 FMS CANBus Interface."

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable Vehicle On Board Diagnostics Interface"
parInfo.parNotes: "Enable ISO9141 and ISO14230 network interface using the LIN line"

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable Warning Debug Messages"
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Setting this parameter to 1 will enable Warning Debug messages"

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable Weight Sensor on Analog Input 1"
parInfo.parNotes: "Enable Weight Sensor on Analog Input 1"

parInfo.parDescription:
"0 - Use automatic detection for OBD protocols. 6 - Mobile Eye
60 - FMS/J1939 250kbit Passive (Not MHub855) 61 - FMS/J1939 250kbit Active (Not MHub855) 62 - FMS/J1939 500kbit Passive (Not MHub855) 63 - FMS/J1939 500kbit Active (Not MHub855)
100 - CAN 500kb / 11-bit OBD requests 129 - CAN 500kb / 29-bit OBD requests 210 - K-Line Fast Initialisation 250 - CAN 250kb / 11-bit 220 - TP2 Instrument 221 - TP2 Engine
All other values default to Mobile Eye Parameter Set
"
parInfo.parNotes:
"0 - Use automatic detection for OBD protocols. 6 - Mobile Eye
60 - FMS/J1939 250kbit Passive (Not MHub855) 61 - FMS/J1939 250kbit Active (Not MHub855) 62 - FMS/J1939 500kbit Passive (Not MHub855) 63 - FMS/J1939 500kbit Active (Not MHub855)
100 - CAN 500kb / 11-bit OBD requests 129 - CAN 500kb / 29-bit OBD requests 210 - K-Line Fast Initialisation 250 - CAN 250kb / 11-bit 220 - TP2 Instrument 221 - TP2 Engine
All other values default to Mobile Eye Parameter Set
"

parInfo.parDescription:
"Manages how the CAN bus is used by the MHub 0 - Full functionality. Sending and receiving of all EOBD protocols possible 166 [0xA6] - OBD2 (ISO15031) disabled. UNSOLICITED MESSAGES PARSED. No commands sent. 172 [0xAC] - OBD2 (ISO15031) disabled. Full KWP2000, UDS and unsolicited data. Useful for vehicles that do not support ISO15031.
Do not enable this if you do not understand the side effects and implications."
parInfo.parNotes:
"Manages how the CAN bus is used by the MHub 0 - Full functionality. Sending and receiving of all EOBD protocols possible 166 [0xA6] - OBD2 (ISO15031) disabled. UNSOLICITED MESSAGES PARSED. No commands sent. 172 [0xAC] - OBD2 (ISO15031) disabled. Full KWP2000, UDS and unsolicited data. Useful for vehicles that do not support ISO15031.
Do not enable this if you do not understand the side effects and implications."

parInfo.parDescription: "ERM Remote Relay ID"
parInfo.parNotes: "The ID of the ERM Remote Relay"

parInfo.parDescription: "Maximum number of accumulated errors before the modem is rebooted"
parInfo.parNotes: "As described in the parameter Reboot Limit, the MHub will issue a reboot command to the modem if it detects a problem with the modem. However if an error is received in response to an instruction to the modem, the MHub will first retry the instruction. This parameter specifies the number of accumulated errors that the MHub can receive from the modem before it will issue a reboot command to the mode."

parInfo.parName: Fuel Data Event at End of Trip
parInfo.parDescription: "Send the Fuel Data event at the end of a trip"
parInfo.parNotes: "Send the Fuel Data event at the end of a trip"

parInfo.parName: Fuel Data Event at Start of Trip
parInfo.parDescription: "Send the Fuel Data event at the start of a trip"
parInfo.parNotes: "Send the Fuel Data event at the start of a trip"

parInfo.parName: Fuel Data Event on Cap Status Change
parInfo.parDescription: "Send the Fuel Data event at when the status of the Fuel Cap status changed"
parInfo.parNotes: "Send the Fuel Data event at when the status of the Fuel Cap status changed"

parInfo.parDescription: "Fuel Data Fuel Level Event"
parInfo.parNotes: "Fuel Data Fuel Level Event will generate OBD2 Fuel Level event and overwrite CANBus Fuel Level."

parInfo.parDescription: "0 Garmin Fleet Function disabled 1 Garmin Fleet Function enabled"
parInfo.parNotes: "0 Garmin Fleet Function disabled 1 Garmin Fleet Function enabled"

parInfo.parDescription: "Global Pass-through enable"
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Set Global Pass-through enable. 1 to enable Modem, GPS, Acc, OBD2,Sim passthrough modes 2 to enable CAN Socket Passthrough"

parInfo.parName: Ignition OFF Source from Main Voltage Threshold
parInfo.parDescription: "Main Voltage Threshold for Ignition Off if Ignition Source from Main Voltage"
parInfo.parNotes: "When main voltage is used as the source of ignition, this parameter is the voltage threshold below which ignition will be assumed OFF. Typically in a 12V vehicle this should be 13V, the parameter is in 100mv steps, thus the value of the parameter will be 130. Setting this value to 0 switches off this functionality and the unit will fall back to normal ignition off detection."

parInfo.parDescription: "The IO Expander have been installed and connected to the MHub"
parInfo.parNotes: "Enable communications with the IO Expander that would give the unit an extra 8 Inputs, 4 Outputs and 2 Analog Inputs. It is important to note that the IO Expander is an external device connected to the MHub."

parInfo.parDescription: "Disable 250kBaud detection."
parInfo.parNotes: "Disable 250kBaud detection."

parInfo.parDescription: "J1939 Filter Disable"
parInfo.parNotes: "J1939 Filter Disable will allow all CANBus messages to be received from the bus"

parInfo.parDescription: "Verify with vehicle manufacturer if the CANBus should be 500kbps Baudrate before setting this parameter."
parInfo.parNotes:
"For 250kbps set OBC 500kbps J1939 FMS CANBus = 0, for 500kbps set OBC 500kbps J1939 FMS CANBus = 1.
The FMS Standard specifies the baudrate to be 250kbps. Verify with vehicle manufacturer if the CANBus should be 500kbps Baudrate before setting this parameter."

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable Active J1939 FMS CANBus"
parInfo.parNotes: "Enable Active J1939 FMS CANBus Verify with vehicle manufacturer if the CANBus should be Active of Passive before setting this parameter."

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable J1939 FMS CANBus Interface. Note: Enable OBD2 CANBus Interface = 0"
parInfo.parNotes: "If the J1939 FMS CANBus is connected to the MHub828 CANbus, this parameter needs to be set to 1 to enable the CAN Bus functionality. Disable the OBD2 CANbus interface"

parInfo.parName: Lock Fake VIN for EOBD Data Requests
parInfo.parDescription: "Prevents the use of the read vehicle VIN for requesting EOBD data. If Fake VIN is programmed then only this will be used to request data. "
parInfo.parNotes:
"Prevents the use of the read vehicle VIN for requesting EOBD data. If Fake VIN is programmed then only this will be used to request data.
"

parInfo.parDescription: "Maximum weight that the vehicle can carry"
parInfo.parNotes: "Maximum weight that the vehicle can carry. Used for calibration of the weight sensor connected to Analog input 1"

parInfo.parDescription: "The amount of time that the unit will wait after rebooting the modem before repeating the process."
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None"

parInfo.parName: Modem Power Down Recovery Standoff Time
parInfo.parDescription: "If the modem is unable to establish an APN session within the allowed attempts then it will power itself down for the configured number of minutes. The frequency with which this can occur is governed by the Modem Power Down Recovery Interval parameter. Setting this to 0 disables this feature. "
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
If the modem is unable to establish an APN session within the allowed attempts then it will power itself down for the configured number of minutes. The frequency with which this can occur is governed by the Modem Power Down Recovery Interval parameter. Setting this to 0 disables this feature. "

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable debug statements for a specific Module"
parInfo.parNotes: "None"

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable debug statements for specific modules - set 2"
parInfo.parNotes: "None"

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable debug statements for specific modules - set 3"
parInfo.parNotes: "None"

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable debug statements for specific modules - set 4"
parInfo.parNotes: "None"

parInfo.parDescription: "OBD2 Lockout time in seconds"
parInfo.parNotes: "OBD2 Lockout time in seconds. If the MHub detects a scantool trying to log into CanBus the MHub will stand off for the Lockout period in seconds. Maximum of 254 seconds. Values of 0 and 255 will disable this feature."

parInfo.parDescription: "Output connected to the buzzer on the Extender"
parInfo.parNotes: "This is the output that is connected to the buzzer on the Extender"

parInfo.parDescription: "Used for requesting a parameter set from XPlatform that will be used to retrieve the true VIN from a particular vehicle type. Note: The length of the VIN must be 13 characters otherwise XPlatform will reject the ID. The ID supplied here will be prefaced with PSD_ to safeguard against accidental VIN entry."
parInfo.parNotes: "Used for requesting a parameter set from XPlatform that will be used to retrieve the true VIN from a particular vehicle type. Note: The length of the VIN must be 13 characters otherwise XPlatform will reject the ID. The ID supplied here will be prefaced with PSD_ to safeguard against accidental VIN entry."

parInfo.parName: Send Weight Sensor Data on Trip End
parInfo.parDescription: "Send Weight Sensor Data on Trip End"
parInfo.parNotes: "Send Weight Sensor Data on Trip End"

parInfo.parName: Send Weight Sensor Data on Trip Start
parInfo.parDescription: "Send Weight Sensor Data on Trip Start"
parInfo.parNotes: "Send Weight Sensor Data on Trip Start"

parInfo.parDescription: "Temperature Sensor 1 ID"
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The MHub has the ability to connect to up to a maximum of 4 temperature sensors. The temperature sensors are pre calibrated digital temperature sensors, and all communicate to the MHub by means of the same communications wire. In order for the MHub to know which of the 4 sensors it is communicating with, this parameter is programmed with the ID value of one of the temperature sensors."

parInfo.parDescription: "Temperature Sensor 2 ID"
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The MHub has the ability to connect to up to a maximum of 4 temperature sensors. The temperature sensors are pre calibrated digital temperature sensors, and all communicate to the MHub by means of the same communications wire. In order for the MHub to know which of the 4 sensors it is communicating with, this parameter is programmed with the ID value of one of the temperature sensors."

parInfo.parDescription: "Temperature Sensor 3 ID"
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The MHub has the ability to connect to up to a maximum of 4 temperature sensors. The temperature sensors are pre calibrated digital temperature sensors, and all communicate to the MHub by means of the same communications wire. In order for the MHub to know which of the 4 sensors it is communicating with, this parameter is programmed with the ID value of one of the temperature sensors."

parInfo.parDescription: "Temperature Sensor 4 ID"
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The MHub has the ability to connect to up to a maximum of 4 temperature sensors. The temperature sensors are pre calibrated digital temperature sensors, and all communicate to the MHub by means of the same communications wire. In order for the MHub to know which of the 4 sensors it is communicating with, this parameter is programmed with the ID value of one of the temperature sensors."

parInfo.parDescription: "Enable TP 2.0 Protocol used by VW Group vehicles; VW, Seat, Audi, etc"
parInfo.parNotes: "Enable TP 2.0 Protocol used by VW Group vehicles; VW, Seat, Audi, etc"

parInfo.parDescription: "This is the level of trace information that would be sent to the debug port"
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None"

parInfo.parDescription: "Vehicle Info Event Mask"
parInfo.parNotes: "Vehicle Info Event Mask: To get configuration value calculate the total value by adding the individual event values together. A value of 65535 will enable all events and 0 will disable all events. Mobileye Brakes 1 Mobileye Left Indicator 2 Mobileye Right Indicator 4 Mobileye Wipers 8 Mobileye Low Beam 16 Mobileye High Beam 32 Mobileye Tamper 64 Mobileye No Comms 128"

parInfo.parDescription: "Relaxes timings on some protocols to enable compatibility with older vehicles. "
parInfo.parNotes: "Relaxes timings on some protocols to enable compatibility with older vehicles. "

parInfo.parDescription: "Weight Sensor Calibration Vector"
parInfo.parNotes:
"!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Weight Sensor Calibration Vector"

parInfo.parDescription: "This is the interval in seconds between successive Weight Sensor Events."
parInfo.parNotes: "This is the interval in seconds between successive Weight Sensor Events. 0 disables the feature"

Auxiliary port is configured as a standard serial port at a baud-rate of 115200 with no add-on device connected to it
